review: General: I don't use cable or satellite TV so I rely on Netflix and now Amazon for non-over the air TV content. As a Prime member, I had rarely taken advantage of the Prime instant videos since my “smart” TV is apparently only smart if one is only in elementary school and I was forced to view the Amazon content on a laptop.  FireTV seems to compliment Netflix well since it has a lot of content not found on Netflix and I find the Prime content has enough choices to make the purchase of the FireTV worthwhile. It should be noted I subscribe to Prime mostly for shipping, so Prime instant videos are a “freebie” for us.Installation and setup: I have to say, installation and set up was a snap. I used the TotalMount system to mount it on my TV, and because the FireTV doesn’t need line of sight to the remote, I installed the box on the back of my TV. The setup was anticlimactic since I expected to “fight” with getting the box to work and all I needed was the password to my router and it connected in a few seconds.Ease of use: While having to keep track of “another” remote wasn’t appealing to me, the included remote is uncluttered and works well. The voice search function on the remote is top notch. I tried several searches, all successful, then handed it to my wife and it had no problems with the voice change. I bought a game controller for the FireTV, so I haven’t tried to use the remote for gaming. Prime choices are clearly marked on the home/navigation screen with Prime Movies and Prime TV and are free to stream. However if you want to purchase them it will cost you.Loading: Loading of the initial games took a bit of time, but after first use they didn’t seem to be any slower than loading a game on a PS3. We have watched several shows with the FireTV and have had ONE incident of a program buffering during the show, compared to Netflix this is a VAST improvement.Image quality: ExcellentAll-in-all, I’m very satisfied with my purchase.
